intro: Armeria labradorica f. glabriscapa, commonly known as the smooth-leaved armeria, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the rocky coastal areas of Labrador and parts of Newfoundland. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features narrow, linear leaves that are typically hairless, giving it its common name. Its flowers are small, white or pale pink, and are arranged in dense, spike-like clusters. It thrives in well-drained, sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in maritime environments.
